00033 // Used to mark special files. The original ESM files are given
00034 // special treatment in a few places, most noticably in loading and
00035 // filtering out "dirtly" GMST entries correctly.
00036 enum SpecialFile
00037   {
00038     SF_Other,
00039     SF_Morrowind,
00040     SF_Tribunal,
00041     SF_Bloodmoon
00042   };
00043 
00044 /* A structure used for holding fixed-length strings. In the case of
00045    LEN=4, it can be more efficient to match the string as a 32 bit
00046    number, therefore the struct is implemented as a union with an int.
00047  */
00048 template <int LEN>
00049 union NAME_T
00050 {
00051   char name[LEN];
00052   int32_t val;
00053 
00054   bool operator==(const char *str)
00055   {
00056     for(int i=0; i<LEN; i++)
00057       if(name[i] != str[i]) return false;
00058       else if(name[i] == 0) return true;
00059     return str[LEN] == 0;
00060   }
00061   bool operator!=(const char *str) { return !((*this)==str); }
00062 
00063   bool operator==(const std::string &str)
00064   {
00065     return (*this) == str.c_str();
00066   }
00067   bool operator!=(const std::string &str) { return !((*this)==str); }
00068 
00069   bool operator==(int v) { return v == val; }
00070   bool operator!=(int v) { return v != val; }
00071 
00072   std::string toString() const { return std::string(name, strnlen(name, LEN)); }
00073 };
00074 
00075 typedef NAME_T<4> NAME;
00076 typedef NAME_T<32> NAME32;
00077 typedef NAME_T<64> NAME64;
00078 typedef NAME_T<256> NAME256;
00079 
00080 #pragma pack(push)
00081 #pragma pack(1)

00083 struct HEDRstruct
00084 {
00085   /* File format version. This is actually a float, the supported
00086      versions are 1.2 and 1.3. These correspond to:
00087      1.2 = 0x3f99999a and 1.3 = 0x3fa66666
00088   */
00089   int version;
00090   int type;           // 0=esp, 1=esm, 32=ess
00091   NAME32 author;      // Author's name
00092   NAME256 desc;       // File description
00093   int records;        // Number of records? Not used.
00094 };
00095 
00096 // Defines another files (esm or esp) that this file depends upon.
00097 struct MasterData
00098 {
00099   std::string name;
00100   uint64_t size;
00101 };
00102 
00103 // Data that is only present in save game files
00104 struct SaveData
00105 {
00106   float pos[6];     // Player position and rotation
00107   NAME64 cell;      // Cell name
00108   float unk2;       // Unknown value - possibly game time?
00109   NAME32 player;    // Player name
00110 };
00111 #pragma pack(pop)

00114 /* This struct defines a file 'context' which can be saved and later
00115    restored by an ESMReader instance. It will save the position within
00116    a file, and when restored will let you read from that position as
00117    if you never left it.
00118  */
00119 struct ESM_Context
00120 {
00121   std::string filename;
00122   uint32_t leftRec, leftSub;
00123   size_t leftFile;
00124   NAME recName, subName;
00125   HEDRstruct header;
00126 
00127   // True if subName has been read but not used.
00128   bool subCached;
00129 
00130   // File position. Only used for stored contexts, not regularly
00131   // updated within the reader itself.
00132   size_t filePos;
00133 };
00134

00153   int getVer() { return c.header.version; }
00154   float getFVer() { return *((float*)&c.header.version); }
00155   int getSpecial() { return spf; }
00156   const std::string getAuthor() { return c.header.author.toString(); }
00157   const std::string getDesc() { return c.header.desc.toString(); }
00158   const SaveData &getSaveData() { return saveData; }

00160   const NAME &retSubName() { return c.subName; }
00161   uint32_t getSubSize() { return c.leftSub; }

00163   /*************************************************************************
00164    *
00165    *  Opening and closing

00172   ESM_Context getContext()
00173   {
00174     // Update the file position before returning
00175     c.filePos = esm->tell();
00176     return c;
00177   }
00178 
00180   void restoreContext(const ESM_Context &rc)
00181   {
00182     // Reopen the file if necessary
00183     if(c.filename != rc.filename)
00184       openRaw(rc.filename);
00185 
00186     // Copy the data
00187     c = rc;
00188 
00189     // Make sure we seek to the right place
00190     esm->seek(c.filePos);
00191   }
00192 
00196   void close()
00197   {
00198     esm.reset();
00199     c.filename.clear();
00200     c.leftFile = 0;
00201     c.leftRec = 0;
00202     c.leftSub = 0;
00203     c.subCached = false;
00204     c.recName.val = 0;
00205     c.subName.val = 0;
00206   }
00207 
00210   void openRaw(Mangle::Stream::StreamPtr _esm, const std::string &name)
00211   {  
00212     close();
00213     esm = _esm;
00214     c.filename = name;
00215     c.leftFile = esm->size();
00216 
00217     // Flag certain files for special treatment, based on the file
00218     // name.
00219     const char *cstr = c.filename.c_str();
00220     if(iends(cstr, "Morrowind.esm")) spf = SF_Morrowind;
00221     else if(iends(cstr, "Tribunal.esm")) spf = SF_Tribunal;
00222     else if(iends(cstr, "Bloodmoon.esm")) spf = SF_Bloodmoon;
00223     else spf = SF_Other;
00224   }
00225 
00228   void open(Mangle::Stream::StreamPtr _esm, const std::string &name)
00229   {
00230     openRaw(_esm, name);
00231 
00232     if(getRecName() != "TES3")
00233       fail("Not a valid Morrowind file");
00234 
00235     getRecHeader();
00236 
00237     // Get the header
00238     getHNT(c.header, "HEDR", 300);
00239 
00240     if(c.header.version != VER_12 &&
00241        c.header.version != VER_13)
00242       fail("Unsupported file format version");
00243 
00244     while(isNextSub("MAST"))
00245       {
00246         MasterData m;
00247         m.name = getHString();
00248         m.size = getHNLong("DATA");
00249         masters.push_back(m);
00250       }
00251 
00252     if(c.header.type == FT_ESS)
00253       {
00254         // Savegame-related data
00255 
00256         // Player position etc
00257         getHNT(saveData, "GMDT", 124);
00258 
00259         /* Image properties, five ints. Is always:
00260            Red-mask:   0xff0000
00261            Blue-mask:  0x00ff00
00262            Green-mask: 0x0000ff
00263            Alpha-mask: 0x000000
00264            Bpp:        32
00265          */
00266         getSubNameIs("SCRD");
00267         skipHSubSize(20);
00268 
00269         /* Savegame screenshot:
00270            128x128 pixels * 4 bytes per pixel
00271          */
00272         getSubNameIs("SCRS");
00273         skipHSubSize(65536);
00274       }
00275   }
00276

00278   {
00279     using namespace Mangle::Stream;
00280     open(StreamPtr(new FileStream(file)), file);
00281   }
00282 
00283   void openRaw(const std::string &file)
00284   {
00285     using namespace Mangle::Stream;
00286     openRaw(StreamPtr(new FileStream(file)), file);
00287   }

00295   // Read data of a given type, stored in a subrecord of a given name
00296   template <typename X>
00297   void getHNT(X &x, const char* name)
00298   {
00299     getSubNameIs(name);
00300     getHT(x);
00301   }
00302 
00303   // Optional version of getHNT
00304   template <typename X>
00305   void getHNOT(X &x, const char* name)
00306   {
00307     if(isNextSub(name))
00308       getHT(x);
00309   }
00310 
00311   // Version with extra size checking, to make sure the compiler
00312   // doesn't mess up our struct padding.
00313   template <typename X>
00314   void getHNT(X &x, const char* name, int size)
00315   {
00316     assert(sizeof(X) == size);
00317     getSubNameIs(name);
00318     getHT(x);
00319   }
00320 
00321   int64_t getHNLong(const char *name)
00322   {
00323     int64_t val;
00324     getHNT(val, name);
00325     return val;
00326   }
00327 
00328   // Get data of a given type/size, including subrecord header
00329   template <typename X>
00330   void getHT(X &x)
00331   {
00332     getSubHeader();
00333     if(c.leftSub != sizeof(X))
00334       fail("getHT(): subrecord size mismatch");
00335     getT(x);
00336   }
00337 
00338   // Version with extra size checking, to make sure the compiler
00339   // doesn't mess up our struct padding.
00340   template <typename X>
00341   void getHT(X &x, int size)
00342   {
00343     assert(sizeof(X) == size);
00344     getHT(x);
00345   }
00346 
00347   // Read a string by the given name if it is the next record.
00348   std::string getHNOString(const char* name)
00349   {
00350     if(isNextSub(name))
00351       return getHString();
00352     return "";
00353   }
00354 
00355   // Read a string with the given sub-record name
00356   std::string getHNString(const char* name)
00357   {
00358     getSubNameIs(name);
00359     return getHString();
00360   }
00361 
00362   // Read a string, including the sub-record header (but not the name)
00363   std::string getHString()
00364   {
00365     getSubHeader();
00366 
00367     // Hack to make MultiMark.esp load. Zero-length strings do not
00368     // occur in any of the official mods, but MultiMark makes use of
00369     // them. For some reason, they break the rules, and contain a byte
00370     // (value 0) even if the header says there is no data. If
00371     // Morrowind accepts it, so should we.
00372     if(c.leftSub == 0)
00373       {
00374         // Skip the following zero byte
00375         c.leftRec--;
00376         char c;
00377         esm->read(&c,1);
00378         return "";
00379       }
00380 
00381     return getString(c.leftSub);
00382   }
00383 
00384   // Read the given number of bytes from a subrecord
00385   void getHExact(void*p, int size)
00386   {
00387     getSubHeader();
00388     if(size !=static_cast<int> (c.leftSub))
00389       fail("getHExact() size mismatch");
00390     getExact(p,size);
00391   }
00392 
00393   // Read the given number of bytes from a named subrecord
00394   void getHNExact(void*p, int size, const char* name)
00395   {
00396     getSubNameIs(name);
00397     getHExact(p,size);
00398   }

00400   /*************************************************************************
00401    *
00402    *  Low level sub-record methods
00403    *
00404    *************************************************************************/
00405 
00406   // Get the next subrecord name and check if it matches the parameter
00407   void getSubNameIs(const char* name)
00408   {
00409     getSubName();
00410     if(c.subName != name)
00411       fail("Expected subrecord " + std::string(name) + " but got " + c.subName.toString());
00412   }
00413 
00419   bool isNextSub(const char* name)
00420   {
00421     if(!c.leftRec) return false;
00422 
00423     getSubName();
00424 
00425     // If the name didn't match, then mark the it as 'cached' so it's
00426     // available for the next call to getSubName.
00427     c.subCached = (c.subName != name);
00428 
00429     // If subCached is false, then subName == name.
00430     return !c.subCached;
00431   }
00432 
00433   // Read subrecord name. This gets called a LOT, so I've optimized it
00434   // slightly.
00435   void getSubName()
00436     {
00437       // If the name has already been read, do nothing
00438       if(c.subCached)
00439         {
00440           c.subCached = false;
00441           return;
00442         }
00443 
00444       // Don't bother with error checking, we will catch an EOF upon
00445       // reading the subrecord data anyway.
00446       esm->read(c.subName.name, 4);
00447       c.leftRec -= 4;
00448     }
00449 
00450   // This is specially optimized for LoadINFO.
00451   bool isEmptyOrGetName()
00452     {
00453       if(c.leftRec)
00454         {
00455           esm->read(c.subName.name, 4);
00456           c.leftRec -= 4;
00457           return false;
00458         }
00459       return true;
00460     }
00461 
00462   // Skip current sub record, including header (but not including
00463   // name.)
00464   void skipHSub()
00465     {
00466       getSubHeader();
00467       skip(c.leftSub);
00468     }
00469 
00470   // Skip sub record and check its size
00471   void skipHSubSize(int size)
00472     {
00473       skipHSub();
00474       if(static_cast<int> (c.leftSub) != size)
00475         fail("skipHSubSize() mismatch");
00476     }
00477 
00478   /* Sub-record header. This updates leftRec beyond the current
00479      sub-record as well. leftSub contains size of current sub-record.
00480   */
00481   void getSubHeader()
00482     {
00483       if(c.leftRec < 4)
00484         fail("End of record while reading sub-record header");
00485 
00486       // Get subrecord size
00487       getT(c.leftSub);
00488 
00489       // Adjust number of record bytes left
00490       c.leftRec -= c.leftSub + 4;
00491 
00492       // Check that sizes added up
00493       if(c.leftRec < 0)
00494         fail("Not enough bytes left in record for this subrecord.");
00495     }
00496 
00499   void getSubHeaderIs(int size)
00500   {
00501     getSubHeader();
00502     if(size != static_cast<int> (c.leftSub))
00503       fail("getSubHeaderIs(): Sub header mismatch");
00504   }
00505 
00506   /*************************************************************************
00507    *
00508    *  Low level record methods
00509    *
00510    *************************************************************************/
00511 
00512   // Get the next record name
00513   NAME getRecName()
00514   {
00515     if(!hasMoreRecs())
00516       fail("No more records, getRecName() failed");
00517     getName(c.recName);
00518     c.leftFile -= 4;
00519 
00520     // Make sure we don't carry over any old cached subrecord
00521     // names. This can happen in some cases when we skip parts of a
00522     // record.
00523     c.subCached = false;
00524 
00525     return c.recName;
00526   }
00527 
00528   // Skip the rest of this record. Assumes the name and header have
00529   // already been read
00530   void skipRecord()
00531     {
00532       skip(c.leftRec);
00533       c.leftRec = 0;
00534     }
00535 
00536   // Skip an entire record, including the header (but not the name)
00537   void skipHRecord()
00538   {
00539     if(!c.leftFile) return;
00540     getRecHeader();
00541     skipRecord();
00542   }
00543 
00544   /* Read record header. This updatesleftFile BEYOND the data that
00545      follows the header, ie beyond the entire record. You should use
00546      leftRec to orient yourself inside the record itself.
00547   */
00548   void getRecHeader() { uint32_t u; getRecHeader(u); }
00549   void getRecHeader(uint32_t &flags)
00550     {
00551       // General error checking
00552       if(c.leftFile < 12)
00553         fail("End of file while reading record header");
00554       if(c.leftRec)
00555         fail("Previous record contains unread bytes");
00556 
00557       getUint(c.leftRec);
00558       getUint(flags);// This header entry is always zero
00559       getUint(flags);
00560       c.leftFile -= 12;
00561 
00562       // Check that sizes add up
00563       if(c.leftFile < c.leftRec)
00564         fail("Record size is larger than rest of file");
00565 
00566       // Adjust number of bytes c.left in file
00567       c.leftFile -= c.leftRec;
00568     }
00569 
00570   bool hasMoreRecs() { return c.leftFile > 0; }
00571   bool hasMoreSubs() { return c.leftRec > 0; }
00572

00574   /*************************************************************************
00575    *
00576    *  Lowest level data reading and misc methods
00577    *
00578    *************************************************************************/
00579 
00580   template <typename X>
00581   void getT(X &x) { getExact(&x, sizeof(X)); }
00582 
00583   void getExact(void*x, int size)
00584   {
00585     int t = esm->read(x, size);
00586     if(t != size)
00587       fail("Read error");
00588   }
00589   void getName(NAME &name) { getT(name); }
00590   void getUint(uint32_t &u) { getT(u); }
00591 
00592   // Read the next 'size' bytes and return them as a string. Converts
00593   // them from native encoding to UTF8 in the process.
00594   std::string getString(int size)
00595   {
00596     char *ptr = ToUTF8::getBuffer(size);
00597     esm->read(ptr,size);
00598 
00599     // Convert to UTF8 and return
00600     return ToUTF8::getUtf8(ToUTF8::WINDOWS_1252);
00601   }
00602 
00603   void skip(int bytes) { esm->seek(esm->tell()+bytes); }
00604   uint64_t getOffset() { return esm->tell(); }
00605 
00607   void fail(const std::string &msg)
00608     {
00609       using namespace std;
00610 
00611       stringstream ss;
00612 
00613       ss << "ESM Error: " << msg;
00614       ss << "\n  File: " << c.filename;
00615       ss << "\n  Record: " << c.recName.toString();
00616       ss << "\n  Subrecord: " << c.subName.toString();
00617       if(esm != NULL)
00618         ss << "\n  Offset: 0x" << hex << esm->tell();
00619       throw std::runtime_error(ss.str());
00620     }
00621
